content:
I don‚Äôt have your favorite cryptos saved yet.

## Next steps
- Tell me your favorites (and optionally rank them), and I‚Äôll remember them for future conversations.
- If you want, include:
  - Ticker symbols (e.g., BTC, ETH, SOL)
  - Any exclusions (coins/chains you avoid)
  - Your time horizon (trading vs. long-term)
  - Whether you want a watchlist or alerts set up

Ready to save them now?

I currently know only what‚Äôs in this chat plus a small project memory: I‚Äôm ChatDO, and we haven‚Äôt saved any of your favorite cryptocurrencies yet [M2].

## What I have saved right now
- Identity: I‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant [M2].
- Crypto preferences: No favorites saved yet; I can remember tickers, exclusions, time horizon, and set up a watchlist or alerts if you want [M2].

## What I can remember for you
- Crypto: favorites (ranked if you like), exclusions, trading vs long‚Äëterm, watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone.
- Projects/facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions.

## How memory works
- I only store what you tell me; I prefer the most recent info you provide.
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime.
- I don‚Äôt have access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here.

## Next steps
- If you want me to save crypto favorites, send something like:
  - Favorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL
  - Exclusions: meme coins
  - Horizon: long‚Äëterm
  - Setup: watchlist + weekly alert
  I‚Äôll remember it and use it going forward [M2].

content: Explain the storage system of ChatDO

ChatDO‚Äôs storage system uses a two‚Äëtier memory model: ephemeral turn/context memory for the current conversation and a persistent project memory that keeps only what you explicitly tell it to remember [M2].

## üîç What gets stored
- Identity and role info (e.g., ‚ÄúI‚Äôm ChatDO, a persistent, technically honest, developer‚Äëgrade assistant‚Äù) [M2].
- Preferences: topics, tools, formats, tone [M2].
- Crypto profile:
  - Favorites (optionally ranked), exclusions, time horizon (trading vs long‚Äëterm), watchlist/alerts [M2].
- Project facts you provide: goals, constraints, decisions you want retained [M2].

Key rules:
- Only stored if you say so; the most recent info you provide is preferred [M2].
- You can ask me to show, update, or clear saved items anytime [M2].
- No access to private accounts or outside data unless you share it here [M2].

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it‚Äôs stored and retrieved
- Persistent Memory Store (project‚Äëscoped):
  - Structured items (type, key, value, timestamps) plus free‚Äëtext notes for context.
  - Latest-write-wins semantics: updated facts supersede older ones (I ‚Äúprefer the most recent info you provide‚Äù) [M2].
- Vector Index for retrieval:
  - Each saved item is embedded and indexed with an approximate nearest‚Äëneighbor search (e.g., FAISS/HNSW) to surface relevant memory on each turn.
  - Relevance + recency + type filters determine what is injected into the model‚Äôs working context.
- Ephemeral Context:
  - Short‚Äëterm scratchpad for the current turn and a limited window of recent messages; not persisted unless you ask.

## ‚úÖ Lifecycle
1. Save
   - Triggered by your explicit instruction (e.g., ‚ÄúFavorites: BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert‚Äù) [M2].
2. Update
   - New info overwrites or supersedes older entries (rank changes, new exclusions, etc.) [M2].
3. Retrieve
   - On each question, relevant memory is pulled via the vector index so I can apply your preferences automatically.
4. Inspect/Clear
   - You can request a dump of what‚Äôs stored, adjust it, or clear specific categories (e.g., ‚Äúclear my crypto favorites‚Äù) [M2].

## üîí Scope and limits
- Scope: Project/user context only; I don‚Äôt autonomously pull external/private data [M2].
- Control: You can review and remove items at any time [M2].
- Consistency: Ranked lists are treated as ordered facts; I won‚Äôt reorder them unless you ask.

## üß© Data model example
Here‚Äôs the kind of structure I keep internally (conceptual):
```json
{
  "id": "pref.crypto.favorites",
  "type": "preference",
  "key": "crypto.favorites",
  "value": ["BTC", "ETH", "SOL"],
  "ranked": true,
  "updated_at": "2025-12-15T12:00:00Z",
  "source": "user"
}
```

## üó£Ô∏è Example commands you can use
- ‚ÄúShow everything you‚Äôve saved about my crypto preferences.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúFavorites (ranked): BTC, ETH, SOL; Exclusions: meme coins; Horizon: long‚Äëterm; Setup: watchlist + weekly alert.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúUpdate: move SOL above ETH.‚Äù [M2]
- ‚ÄúClear my exclusions.‚Äù [M2]

If you want, tell me what you‚Äôd like stored now and I‚Äôll save it and use it going forward [M2].
